<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How to query OrientDB database for vertex in Java?: :I want to connect to an OrientDB. The OrientDB contains one unique node with the property "SPECIAL-NODE". I want to query the database for this node and print it out. I have one line of code that works using an iterator (see below) and one that does not (below at bottom). It seems like both should work yet only the first does, the second does not. Why is this the case?Thanks!// create Orient graph object and connect to database, works successfullyOrientGraph ograph = new OrientGraph("remote:localhost/test", "username", "password");// this WORKS - finds the one special node and prints it outIterator<Vertex> i =ograph.getVertices("SPECIAL-NODE", "SPECIAL").iterator();System.out.println(i.next());// this DOES NOT WORK. WHY???System.out.println("SPECIAL NODE: " + ograph.getVertexByKey("SPECIAL-NODE",   "SPECIAL"));
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How to query OrientDB database for vertex in Java?: :I want to connect to an OrientDB. The OrientDB contains one unique node with the property "SPECIAL-NODE". I want to query the database for this node and print it out. I have one line of code that works using an iterator (see below) and one that does not (below at bottom). It seems like both should work yet only the first does, the second does not. Why is this the case?Thanks!// create Orient graph object and connect to database, works successfullyOrientGraph ograph = new OrientGraph("remote:localhost/test", "username", "password");// this WORKS - finds the one special node and prints it outIterator<Vertex> i =ograph.getVertices("SPECIAL-NODE", "SPECIAL").iterator();System.out.println(i.next());// this DOES NOT WORK. WHY???System.out.println("SPECIAL NODE: " + ograph.getVertexByKey("SPECIAL-NODE",   "SPECIAL"));
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: The reason why the second code does not work is because the `getVertexByKey` method returns an `Optional` object. When you call `next()` on an `Optional` object, it will throw a `NoSuchElementException` if the `Optional` is empty. In your case, the `Optional` is empty because there is no vertex with the key "SPECIAL-NODE" and the class "SPECIAL" in the database.

To fix this, you should check if the `Optional` is empty before calling `next()` on it. If it is empty, you can handle the situation accordingly (for example, by printing a message to indicate that no special node was found). Here is how you can modify your code:

```java
Optional<Vertex> optionalVertex = ograph.getVertexByKey("SPECIAL-NODE", "SPECIAL");
if (optionalVertex.isPresent()) {
    System.out.println("SPECIAL NODE: " + optionalVertex.get());
} else {
    System.out.println("No special node found.");
}
```

In this code, `isPresent()` checks if the `Optional` contains a non-null value, and `get()` returns the value if it is present.
